Reviews.Title: Decent phone.
Reviews.Author: Lionel B.
Reviews.Content: I find the Samsung Galaxy Pro to be a decent messaging phone.Pros:Nice looking phoneLightOne of the few android phones with the external keyboardHas touch screenPretty responsive.Okay:Keyboard is fine to type with.Although light, it takes a few days to get used to the plastic feel.Battery life can get you through a day for an average user3 mp camera but no flash.Cons:Screen resolution not the bestNo multitouch but you can double tab zoom.Price a tad high - under $200 would be more reasonable.Overall:I find the Pro acceptable as a basic smartphone.  It's android, it has an external keyboard, and I don't do that much internet browsing. If the price were under $200 then it would be a deal despite some of its shortcomings but overall it is still a decent budget phone. You can find several detailed reviews of the phone on the web including engadget mobile [...]

Reviews.Title: WYSIWYG
Reviews.Author: joentisu
Reviews.Content: Nice dessign, lightweight. A good entry option to Android OS based equipments for those who want to feel real keys under their thumbs / fingers. However, after realizing many apps will force you to put the equipment sideways you will start asking yourself why didn't you go for full touch screen right from the start.Call quality is good. GPS works fine also, camera is fair under good lightning (no flash)

Reviews.Title: Very nice for te price. Perfect for old Blackberry users
Reviews.Author: Edmundo Pimentel "SAP / ABAP Wiz"
Reviews.Content: I bought for my mom, cause she is not very technological and this would be her first Android. I couldn't be there to give it in person, so every support that i gave her was by the phone. I was very surprise that  she got everything right away, connecting to wifi, installing apps, making phone calls, and even syncing with google account every contact.The phone itself its not fast, but that what you get for the price. Descent picture quality. Perfect for Blackberry user that are used to haven a candy bar phone with the qwerty keyboard. Touch screen its a plus, cause it helps new user (like senior person) to get used to touch the screen to trigger an action.

Reviews.Title: Good Phone
Reviews.Author: Noor
Reviews.Content: If you're one of those high tech people that absolutely adores the latest technology smart phones, then this probably isn't for you. Me? I just wanted an upgrade from my regular non-smart phone. And this phone seems great. Got it yesterday; been messing with it all day. I LOVE that it has a touch screen AND a GREAT keyboard. In fact, the keyboard is exceptional. The touch screen is great too. It gets the job done without any glitches. It's a great phone, really. I'd recommend getting a memory card when you buy this if you don't already have one, otherwise you can't take pictures and save them. But really, this phone's great for those that wanted to upgrade to a smart phone, just not one of those iPhone/latest technology HD phones with all the extra goodies.

Reviews.Title: OK for the price
Reviews.Author: JBRITTIN
Reviews.Content: This phone was ok for the price but screen was too small to be touch screen. The screen resolution was low, and it would shut of on me at any time. Usually once every day. It was returned.

Reviews.Title: perfecto
Reviews.Author: Jorge de Venezuela
Reviews.Content: el teléfono es perfecto levanta 3g en digitella batería me dura el día completo y hasta un poco mas depende del usoel teclado muy bueno para escribir es rápido trae un gestor de correo de samsung y llegan push corre angry bird space perfecto

Reviews.Title: Great budget piece
Reviews.Author: Porsy
Reviews.Content: I just got the phone from a local Samsung dealer and it's not quite the Galaxy S II but with the price and the function. I can say it's a bargain. A phone with Blackberry like features, small, light and all that android has in stores. I got mine for under $200 so I will say go get one!!!

Reviews.Title: Good phone
Reviews.Author: Carrie D Roberts
Reviews.Content: Pros:  Touch screen with QWERTY keyboardCons:  No spell checkI've had this phone now for three years.  I've dropped it, kicked it, and splashed it with a bottle of water.  I have fat fingers so I love the QWERTY instead of the touch screen keypad.  I dread knowing that almost all smartphones have gone to touchscreen only.  I was disappointed in knowing that it doesn't have a spell check and yes I've checked and called Samsung.  I just had to make sure of what I had typed out before hitting send.  The original battery finally died and wont hold a charge for longer then a few hours this last week.  I'll be replacing the battery instead of replacing the phone.

Reviews.Title: excellent phone
Reviews.Author: LUIS GUTIERREZ
Reviews.Content: very good phone, simple but efficient. very fluid touch screen. also has QWERTY keyboard for more comfortable writing. android version 2.2 froyo kies not upgradable

Reviews.Title: BEST TOUGHTSCREEN + KEYBOARD
Reviews.Author: wojciech galazka
Reviews.Content: i bought this samsung phone because i needed an toughtscreen phone with keyboard. this two element increase the comfort when you are writing messages o mails or when you surf the net. i can add that the price was the best. i think that this phone has the best relation between price/size/software caracteristics. i recommedn it.
